intro: Hieracium stupposipilum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It features a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with prominent central disks. Hieracium stupposipilum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in open, sunny areas.
